speaker: Summit Shrine
lines: Your strike rings like a bell. The wind stops to listen.
Something old and patient decides you must be taught manners.
Frost leaps from the plinth like startled birds, vanishing mid-flight.
A crack travels the stone and then returns, as if reconsidering.
The air warms by a breath and then withdraws it.
The lesson arrives with footsteps you feel first in your teeth.

choices.text: If it must be taught, I will learn.
Bow and leave the peak unprovoked.
